Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which people come to the US specifically to have babies and gain citizenship for their children.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all babies born to non-citizen parents in the US are a result of deliberate actions to gain citizenship, without considering other reasons for giving birth in the US.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that people come to the US solely for the purpose of having babies.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why individuals may choose to give birth in the US, such as access to better healthcare or family connections.
